data.title: Everything Local: Breaking News, Events, Discussions
data.meta_description: The best breaking news, stories, and events from the Patch network of local news sites
data.text:
Read the latest stories from Patch's team of local journalists

Pacific Palisades, CA|5m

Meeting Set For Path Connecting Wolfberg Park To Will Rogers Beach

George Wolfberg Park at Potrero Canyon has been open for nearly two years, but it's still missing its link to PCH and the ocean.

Huntington, NY|14m

Man Robs Person Of Phone, Cash At Huntington Station Deli: Police

The man displayed what appeared to be a knife and stole the person's property, police say.

Perry Hall, MD|18m

BCPS Has Fewer Teacher Vacancies: Hiring Push, Job Cuts Explain Why

Baltimore County recruited teachers with TV ads. It also cut hundreds of vacant educator jobs. Here's why the staffing rate is so high.

St. Charles, IL|56m

Opposition Mounts For Charles Farm Development, Annexation

Pulte Homes is requesting the city of St. Charles annex the 970-acre site.

Odenton-Severn, MD|1h

Mucho Gusto Opens Mexican Restaurant In Gambrills

A Mexican restaurant opened its first Anne Arundel County location. The locally-owned eatery has tableside guac and award-winning cocktails.

North Fork, NY|2h

New Construction 'Biggest Issue' During Storm On North Fork: Supe

Supervisor Al Krupski said, for the most part, the town's efforts in investing in drainage have "paid off."

Princeton, NJ|3h

Princeton Hires Consultants To Advise On New Sign Ordinance

The municipality has hired LRK Inc. The draft ordinance is expected to be ready early next year.

Southampton, NY|3h

Southampton Emerges Relatively Unscathed From Storm: 'We Held Up Okay'

Potential future erosion, however, remains an issue on Southampton Town beaches and federal help is needed, officials told Patch.

Oxford, CT|3h

Victims Of Fatal Floodwaters In Oxford Identified: State Police

Two women died as a result of being caught in torrential water which swept a portion of western Connecticut late Sunday afternoon.

Darien, IL|3h

Felony Charges Denied In Darien Gun Case: Cops

A man pulled out what appeared to be a handgun in a road rage incident, police said.

Mahwah, NJ|3h

Saddle River To Vote On Hiring Bowhunters To 'Cull' Deer, Coyotes

One Bergen County town will vote on whether to hire bowhunters to conduct a controversial "cull" of deer and coyote.

Mokena, IL|10m

Frankfort Woman, 18, Killed In Mokena Crash ID'd: Coroner

The Frankfort woman was a passenger in a Camaro that collided with a Land Rover Thursday night in Mokena.

Newport Beach-Corona Del Mar, CA|3h

Tow Truck Driver Loses Leg In Horrific 55 Freeway Pileup

A tow truck driver who stopped to help the driver of a disabled car on the 55 freeway was struck by a car in a pileup early Monday morning.

East Brunswick, NJ|5h

Gaza Ceasefire Advocate Is Running For Mayor In East Brunswick

Dr. Ateka Gunja will be challenging Mayor Brad Cohen and Republican Eugene DeMarzo this November.

Livingston, NJ|5h

Flood Waters Trap Cars In Livingston, Cause Havoc Around Town

A heavy storm trapped cars, flooded basements and washed away road asphalt in Livingston. More rain may be on the way, forecasters say.

Montclair, NJ|4h

Flood Waters Rise In Montclair, More Rain Expected: Forecasters

A heavy storm caused severe flash flooding across the region – including in Montclair.

Belleville-Nutley, NJ|1h

Epic Flooding Soaks Essex County, Sends Rescuers Scrambling (PHOTOS)

The weather woes may not be over yet, forecasters warn. Here’s a recap of the damage and rainfall counts in Essex County.

Arlington Heights, IL|7h

School District 'Complicit' With Former Nurse's Actions: Lawyer

An ex-nurse at Westgate Elementary was arrested Friday following an investigation into the misuse of students' prescription drugs.

Edison-Metuchen, NJ|3h

Edison BOE President Will Not To Seek Reelection

Biral Patel served on the Edison Board of Education for four years.

Concord, NH|7h

Bow, Concord Women Seek Open NH District 15 State Senate Seat: Watch

3 Democrats and a Republican seek to replace Becky Whitley, D-Hopkinton. They explain why they are running in this Patch/Concord TV forum.

Worcester, MA|4h

WPI Plans To Turn Worcester Hotels Into Student Housing

A WPI takeover of the Hampton Inn and Courtyard Marriott would mean millions in lost revenue for the city.

Oak Lawn, IL|10h

17-Year-Old Charged In Chicago Ridge Mall Shooting

The 17-year-old shot another 17-year-old during an altercation outside the mall, Chicago Ridge police said.

Rye, NY|1d

Newest Playland Ride Makes The Entire Westchester Coast An Attraction

For a limited time, the iconic amusement park is taking to the sea for a voyage that blurs the lines of both time and space.

Norwalk, CT|6h

Sign Up For New Norwalk Target Store, Grand Opening Teased

The new Target replaces the city's second Walmart store, which closed late last year at the same location.

Riverhead, NY|12h

Adam Pascal Reflects On "Celebrating 30 Years Of Friendship & 'Rent'"

"Rent" stars Adam Pascal and Anthony Rapp brought music and memories to the stage at The Suffolk Sunday night.

Joliet, IL|6h

Aykroyd, Belushi Rock Prison: 24 Photos

In what might be their final trip to Joliet, Aykroyd and Belushi rocked a crowd of roughly 5,000 people for the Blues Brothers Con 2024.

Oak Lawn, IL|1d

1 Shot At Chicago Ridge Mall, Several In Custody: Police

Chicago Ridge police say there is no active shooter threat and the shooting is believed to be an isolated incident.

Tinley Park, IL|1d

Juvenile Shot At McCarthy Park In Tinley Park: Officials

The shooting happened Saturday night, Village Manager Pat Carr said.

Buffalo Grove, IL|2h

Man Found Dead In Car At Grocery Store: Buffalo Grove PD

A large fire and police presence was on scene for over three hours following the Saturday afternoon discovery.

Concord, NH|2d

Concord School District Rehires Suspended Elementary School Teacher

Melissa Noyes, who relinquished her certification after violating the educator code of conduct, will return to the classroom this fall.

Murrieta, CA|2d

Traffic Alternative Between Murrieta, Temecula Might Get An Update

For motorists moving between Murrieta and Temecula, ​Jackson Avenue is often used as an alternative to Interstates 15 and 215.

Redondo Beach, CA|2d

Beach Cities Residents Save $182M In Healthcare Expenses Yearly

Adults in the Beach Cities have much lower healthcare bills compared to the rest of the U.S., a new Gallup study found.

Joliet, IL|2d

Murderer Hides Body In Joliet, Jury Returns Guilty Verdicts

An off-duty Joliet police officer who was out hunting came across Danica Ford's body in November 2018.

Greenwich, CT|3d

Patsy's Pizzeria, Of East Harlem Fame, Officially Opens In Greenwich

After months of waiting, the pizzeria finally opened in Greenwich this week.

Channahon-Minooka, IL|3d

Happy Falafel Grand Opening Falls Apart In Channahon

Channahon's Hive Kitchen alerted everyone that due to the need for further inspections, Happy Falafel is not allowed to open this weekend.

Across America, US|3d

Entitled, Rude Parents Ruin School Drop-Off For Everyone [Block Talk]

Readers said getting the kids out of the car without delay is the code, but another pointed out “there are challenges you cannot see.”

Hillsborough, NJ|3d

Road Work Updates In Hillsborough: 9 More Roads To Be Repaved

Deputy Mayor John Ciccarelli provided a road update on Tuesday.

Woodridge, IL|3d

Brinkman 'Looking Forward' To New Role As Deputy Chief Of Woodridge PD

Dennis Brinkman was sworn in as the next Deputy Chief of the Woodridge Police Department on Thursday.

Marlboro-Coltsneck, NJ|3d

New Farm Aims To Nurture Family, Sense Of Community In Marlboro

Devon Levesque started Sweet Honey Farm to support happiness, health and long lives through its bounty.

Murrieta, CA|3d

ID Released On Homicide Victim Pronounced Dead At Murrieta City Hall

Her alleged killer is due to appear in court Aug. 22.
